intro: Lasianthus linearisepalus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
